I also love vintage stores, especially Jenny Vander. I buy cute seasonal staples from Very Ireland – they're perfect for some dopamine dressing. I love ChloBo Jewellery too. I adore candle shopping in TK Maxx as well, it's free aromatherapy!" Any fashion crimes she's committed? "As a child I poured Lucozade down my Communion dress because I thought it would look better pink. Nowadays, I like to experiment with fashion and wear things that are bright, funky and positive. In terms of crimes I can probably look like a walking highlighter at times. But I think being playful in your sense of style means you can have fun." She loves the fact that the early 2000s trends are coming full circle. "I feel like interpreting trends in your own way is what makes fashion so exciting and you really don't have to spend to look good – circular fashion, repurposing and upcycling has never been more stylish." With regards to her style crush, she loved Sydney Sweeney at fashion week and on the red carpet for awards season. "She is such a bombshell and wears a lot of Miu Miu. Opt for a fit that looks best on you, don't go by sizing labels. Instinctively go for what makes you feel beautiful and what you enjoy wearing. That famous Emma Thompson quote resonates with me: 'Don't waste your life's purpose worrying about your body. This is your vessel, it's your house. It's where you live – there's no point in judging it'." Her handbag essentials include her Kindle, headphones and usually a coffee cup flask. "I love my skincare. I've actually worn them a few times to events and red carpets. Ironically, I found a pair of black patent Jimmy Choo peep toes in my size in my local charity shop for €30. So that kind of balances the whole wedding shoes investment!" How about the most stylish place she's visited? "I did some fashion buying for a brand in Florence and Milan and I loved it. In terms of street style, probably Paris. The locals dress so chic and understated and the tourists are more eclectic." This article originally appeared in the May issue of RSVP.
